text: Albrecht Altodorfer was a German painter, engraver and builder of the Renaissance. He was probably born around the year 1480, in Altdorf, Lower Bavaria, or Regensburg. He died on 12 February 1538 in Regensburg. Together with Wolf Huber, he is seen as one of the main people in the Danube school. The danube school was an art movement that spread along the Danube, in Germany and Austria. With Albrecht DÃ¼rer he founded the Little Masters (original: Kleinmeister) of Nuremberg. ==Related pages== *German art Category:1480s births Category:1538 deaths Category:German painters
title: Albrecht Altdorfer
